reviewText: A wonderful, behind-the-scenes look at the world of professional magic, and particularly the female assistants who were integral to the performances. Off-stage, these women were often responsible for a number of duties (sometimes including being the magician's wife), in addition to being unsung stage professionals themselves. Beyond being lovely distractions--often aiding a magician's crucial attempts to misdirect an audience--their role also required an unflappable demeanor and split-second timing. Finally, these overlooked show business troopers get their own star turn in a surprisingly entertaining and illuminating documentary.
